raised.name: description
raised.text: boxBar is a Blackbox for Windows plugin that provides a system bar. It is designed to be easily extensible, and is becoming more configurable. Its current major feature is that allows a vertical bar.

boxBar has been tested with boxCore on Windows Vista x64 by the author, and on Windows XP by users. It should also work under other branches (except xoblite at this point, due to task support), and has had some testing under vanilla bbLean.

flat.name: initial setup
flat.text:
To load boxBar, just add the relative path of the plugin (from your Blackbox directory) to the Blackbox configuration file
plugins.rc (located in the Blackbox directory). For example, if you installed Blackbox into C:\Blackbox, and boxBar.dll is located in C:\Blackbox\Plugins\boxBar, you should add the line
Plugins\boxBar\boxBar.dll to plugins.rc. Simple, eh? :)

flat.name: boxBar.rc settings
flat.text: boxBar reads an rc file with the same name as the plugin. So if you leave it as boxBar.dll it will read boxBar.rc. If you rename the plugin to otherBar.dll then it will read otherBar.rc. The setting names within the rc file do not change with the plugin name, only the name of the file read
Currently, boxBar supports the following settings which are intended to be changed by users. They are included in the default rc file.

setting.name: boxBar.items
setting.desc: Items which appear in the bar, described in detail in the items section

setting.name: boxBar.vertical
setting.desc: Is the bar vertical or horizontal

setting.name: boxBar.percentage
setting.desc: The percentage of the monitor to use

setting.name: boxBar.toggleWithPlugins
setting.desc: Toggle visibility with plugins

setting.name: boxBar.useSlit
setting.desc: Plugin in slit if available

setting.name: boxBar.tasks.iconsize
setting.desc: Size of icons for tasks (16 or 32 looks good)

setting.name: boxBar.tray.iconsize
setting.desc: Size of tray icons (16 looks best)

setting.name: boxBar.tray.vertical
setting.desc: Sets the tray to vertical or horizontal.

setting.name: boxBar.tray.maxCols
setting.desc: Maximum number of icons per row. (0 disables)

setting.name: boxBar.tray.maxRows
setting.desc: Maximum number of icons per column. (0 disables)

setting.name: boxBar.tray.maxRows
setting.desc: Maximum number of icons per column. (0 disables)

setting.name: boxBar.clock.format
setting.desc: What is displayed on a clock label

setting.name: boxBar.clock.tipFormat
setting.desc: What is displayed on the clock tooltip

flat.text: boxBar also supports the following settings, but use them with caution. They are not included in the default rc.

setting.name: boxBar.spacingBorder
setting.desc: Bar border spacing

setting.name: boxBar.spacingItems
setting.desc: Bar inter-item spacing

setting.name: boxBar.tasks.spacingBorder
setting.desc: Taskarea border spacing

setting.name: boxBar.tasks.spacingItems
setting.desc: Taskarea inter-item spacing

setting.name: boxBar.tasks.task.spacingBorder
setting.desc: Border spacing inside a task

setting.name: boxBar.tasks.task.spacingItems
setting.desc: Gap between task icon and text

setting.name: boxBar.tray.spacingBorder
setting.desc: Tray border spacing

setting.name: boxBar.tray.spacingItems
setting.desc: Tray area inter-item spacing

flat.name: boxBar items
flat.text: You can use as many or as few of the following item to make up your boxBar.items: setting. Duplicates are allowed, but do not use spaces. The default is:
A clock label on your bar. It is configured by settings starting boxBar.clock

A section which contains the current tasks. You can adjust settings for this by changing settings starting with boxBar.tasks. This section will expand to fill as much space as possible. Leftclick activates a task.
A system tray area. Will display all your tray icons. Can be set to have a speicifc number of rows or columns as well as opther settings through the settings starting with boxBar.tray.
A label to indicate your current workspace. Leftclick goes to next, rightclick to previous.

flat.name: additional notes
flat.text: This plugin will not create, delete or edit any files at all except for the boxBar.rc file.
